title: Camille's design from a balance standpoint is an absolute disaster. (Rant, down vote, whatever)
body:
I would like to continue to see nerfs to this champion but I believe that her kit will never allow her to be truly balanced unless it actually loses something. I know Riot likes to adjust numbers little by little but Camille's kit design is just way to cluttered and as a result she gets a crazy ton of free power AND protection. Camille has a severe Identity crises now because her kit's chaotic cluster doesn't allow her to pick an actual proper class and focus on it.

Camille has:

Assassin Damage
Tank Stat Growth
Fighter/Jungler Mobility

That is seriously not good. Riot needs to seriously sit down and decide what they want Camille to be, because right now she is everything and its making her the best champion in the game with all kinds of free power.

**Assassin Identity**
If they decide they want her to be an assassin then several things i feel really need to change.

- Increase Ad Ratios and true damage on Q slightly
- Increase AD Ratios
- Change her passive to a more damage based one
- Reduce HP and Armor/Mr Growth
- Remove Bonus Movement Speed on Q
- Remove healing on W.
- Remove Bonus Attack Speed on E
- Remove Stun on E.
- Remove splash damage on E
- Allow Ult to actually be escapable

I honestly think the Assassin identity for Camille honestly fits her character the best, keeping the burst and mobility will allow her to make split second judgments on when to assassinate a target. Camille Already does this but she get the free Tank growth stats and escapes to get in and get out without any risk and all reward. Having to force her to go more damage will mean that a bad assassination call could be fatal and punishable for her.

**Tank identity**
I really dont understand why Camille would need to be a tank but for whatever reason, if they want her to truly be one then I believe several power shifts need to change.

- Increase passive shield strength.
- Increase healing on W.
- Remove True damage on Q.
- Reduce how far she can leap with E.
- Remove splash damage on E
- Disallow E to leap over walls.
- Remove bonus attack speed on E.
- Remove bonus damage on ult.

Like i said, I really don't understand how tank play would fit Camille's character at all but for some reason they wanted it, if that's what they wanted her to be then this might work. it would remove her crazy burst and true damage which a  tank should never have, but allow her to be more meaningful in fights with her utility.

**Fighter Identity**
This is the second class i think would fit Camille as well. Balanced out mobility and damage would be the best bet here and i think would make the most sense for her character in terms of being fighter rather then an assassin.

- Change passive cool down to a solid 15 seconds at all ranks.
- Increase movement speed on Q
- Reduce Armor/Mr growth
- Remove reduced Damage on jungle monsters for W
- Reduce true damage on Q
- Reduce healing on W
- Remove splash damage on E
- Reduce bonus damage on ult.

I think with these changes this allows Camille to be an actual fighter. She'll have the damage and mobility for some great plays but she wont have the burst of an assassin or the survivability of a tank to back it.

**Closing**
I am actually pretty baffled that Camille was allowed to break a lot of champion design rules and fundamentals upon her creation and the result we got was this unstoppable permanently banned monster who does literally everything and is not fun to face at all. Am I salty? Probably. Will I be down voted? oh you know it. Will that stop my voice or opinion from being heard? not in  the slightest, and thats all i really care about it. it helps me vent .

Honestly, I don't think an inescapable ultimate has any place in League.

If you are playing a squishy champion and you get caught in her ultimate, you are just dead.  There's no way you can fight back against a fighter (or an assassin) at close range when you can't kite.   It's even worse if you are a champion who can't fight (such a support), in which case you can't do anything except for die.

Positioning is supposed to be one of the most important aspects of League.  A champion who can completely deny your ability to position breaks the rules too much.

Or your team can blow her up since she dove your back line. Many supports can pull her off of you or out of her ult. Some ADC's like Vayne can push her out of it too. Just because she ults, does not make her immortal, so you always could just kill her, and having 2 types of damage is a very good way to do so because her passive blocks only one kind of damage. Some champions, like Zed and Shaco, can actually cause her to "miss" her ult (it goes on CD but the cage is never made and she is still charged for the mana) if they time their own ults well.

Objectively, you're just wrong so far. She has been nerfed, and her statline and playstyle is quite similar to Irelia's. Her ban rate has gone down SIGNIFICANTLY in platinum+ elo, and her winrate is less than 50% as of now. If her winrate goes up due to people getting more practice, then fine. But as far as I'm concerned, her kit really isn't very cluttered. It all centralizes around one concept; which is to snowball the lane.
Camille, in my opinion, is a lane specialist; meaning that she excels in laning. If she's unable to win out in laning phase either with solo kills, farm leads, or better roams, she becomes phenomenally less successful come mid and late game.
Her entire kit is made to snowball top, and she has extremely potent counters which stop her from doing this (Poppy is a biggie, but also scalers like Fiora, and tanks like Shen).
Really, the only reason people complain about her snowball specifically is that A) she's a lane specialist, and B) in the mid-game she can take over games with triforce power spikes. Irelia can do the same thing, except she's not as strong in lane, and scales better. Both champions can still one shot ads if their fed, but which kit do you think is healthier?
